title.value: Immunotherapeutic targeting of surfaceome heterogeneity in AML
title.justification: The paper's title directly reflects its central theme of exploring immunotherapy strategies for targeting surfaceome variations in acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
title.quote:
Resource

Immunotherapeutic targeting of surfaceome heterogeneity in AML

extractions.description: This paper investigates the potential of immunotherapy to address the heterogeneity of the surfaceome in acute myeloid leukemia (AML). Through a comprehensive analysis of the surface proteome of diverse primary human AML specimens, it identifies several antigens and leukemia stem cell markers. The study leverages proteomics and transcriptomics to uncover AML subgroup-specific antigens and proposes potential therapeutic antibodies for targeting AML heterogeneity.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental procedures like proteomics and transcriptomics analyses of AML specimens to study the heterogeneity and identify potential immunotherapeutic targets.
type.quote: Here, to identify potential targets for immunotherapeutic intervention, we analyze the surface proteome of 100 genetically diverse primary human AML specimens for the identification of cell surface proteins and conduct single-cell transcriptome analyses on a subset of these specimens to assess antigen expression at the sub-population level.

name.justification: The paper's focus on immunotherapy for acute myeloid leukemia (AML) places it primarily in the field of Immunotherapy within Hematology.
name.quote: This study positions immunotherapy as a promising approach to target AML heterogeneity

name.justification: The research involves analyzing the surface proteome of AML specimens.
name.quote: We designed a proteomics-based approach for AML surfaceome exploration

name.justification: The research includes transcriptome analyses to assess antigen expression.
name.quote: Conduct single-cell transcriptome analyses on a subset of these specimens to assess antigen expression at the sub-population level.

name.justification: The LASA is a dataset developed as part of the study to analyze surface proteome and transcriptome data for AML.
name.quote: The Leucegene AML Surfaceome Atlas (LASA) (https://lasa.leucegene.ca), enabling surface proteome and transcriptome analyses using SPAT and cell type annotations.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The LASA dataset is a contribution from the Leucegene project.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Leucegene project at Institute for Research in Immunology and Cancer, Université de Montréal, Montréal, QC H3T 1J4, Canada.
